meanings.definition: A ring-like muscle that constricts to close an opening.
meanings.sent1: The sphincters in the eye help control the amount of light entering.
meanings.sent2: Doctors study how sphincters work to understand digestion better.
meanings.sent3: The sphincters at the amusement park gates only let in one person at a time.
meanings.sent4: Her determination was like the sphincters of a vault, tightly guarding her secrets.
meanings.sent5: The sphincters of the heart valves ensure blood flows in the right direction.

meanings.definition: A circular band of muscle that regulates the passage of substances.
meanings.sent1: Sphincters in blood vessels help control blood flow.
meanings.sent2: The digestive system relies on sphincters to manage food movement.
meanings.sent3: The sphincters in the garden hose prevent water from flowing too fast.
meanings.sent4: His words acted like sphincters, carefully filtering what he shared.
meanings.sent5: The sphincters of the airways keep harmful particles out of the lungs.
